definition: large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: The Clanker Lords had their slave soldiers drilling in the nearest field.
sentences.chinese: 克蘭克的大人們讓他們的奴隸士兵在最近的校場操練。

definition: to glower (at sb)/to cast an angry look
reception pavilion (generally part of a large residence, and often built in a garden)
bell made of copper or bronze
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
magnificent army with thousands of men and horses (idiom); impressive display of manpower/all the King's horses and all the King's men
area above the lintel of a doorway
